attributes.action: Urge the Chinese government to stop the annual Yulin Dog Eating Festival
attributes.background:
Thousands of dogs are annually tortured to death during the Yulin Dog Meat festival. They are skinned alive, boiled to death, beaten, burned and dismembered while still alive. 
Yulin began in 2009; it is not tradition. Nor is there a valid comparison between the eating of beef or lamb and dog-meat.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2016 11 million people worldwide signed a petition against dog slaughter at Yulin. http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/asia/yulin-dog-meat-festival-ban-petition-11-million-sign-slaughters-thousands-animals-china-a7081521.html
Despite this the festival went ahead in 2017. 
Unlike cattle, dogs/cats have a greater understanding of suffering:
https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/animal/article/identifying-and-monitoring-pain-in-farm-animals-a-review/CECEC60BB101FF770ED7E594E0CCE8BA

attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Reject HS2 Phase 2a proposed scheme to save Blithbury Reindeer Lodge
attributes.background: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge will be severely affected or face closure due to the current HS2 phase 2a proposed scheme.
attributes.additional_details: Blithbury Reindeer Lodge was set up by Mr Swinnerton in 2007.  Under the current scheme, the lodge would be affected by a purchase of land and the relocation of the B5014. All the land is utilized for grazing and relocation is not an option. Realignment of the road will cause disruption, noise and air pollution. If the land is acquired the lodge will have no option but to close.

attributes.action: Reduce student loan interest to an affordable 1% over base rate.
attributes.background: With the current punitive and profiteering rate of RPI + 3% typical loans of £50k require a salary of £55k pa just to pay the £3,000 interest. The rate charged is excessive and leaves a lifetime millstone for most graduate leavers. Give the majority an attainable goal and a sense of hope!

attributes.action: Enshrine in law that foreign nationals hold medical insurance before entry to UK
attributes.background: The NHS is free at point of contact for all. Foreign Nationals often use the NHS then leave the country without paying for treatment. I therfore petition parliament to enshrine in law that ALL Foreigners should hold medical insurance and must prove that they hold this before entering the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The UK needs to look after the NHS and nurture it. We have the finest health care system in the world. But it can no longer cope with the influx and lack of funding. Making sure that foreign nationals have health insurance before they enter the UK will help elevate some of the funding issues the NHS currently has. It will also eliminate health tourism and free up appointments that are much needed for UK Nationals.

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: Put Stonehenge into special measures Remove Stonehenge from EH Management
attributes.background: Since splitting with Historic England, English Heritage has commercialized Stonehenge to the extreme introducing a 'Pay to Pray' Policy at Solstices and priced Tourism out of reach for the General Public to whom it was left, and supported unsuitable road improvements in the World Heritage site.
attributes.additional_details: They have rejected the advice and concerns of UNESCO, Senior Archaeologists, Historians, Druids, and Environmentalists. This shows they are not fit to manage the 'Jewel in the Crown' of a World Heritage site.

attributes.action: Provide short term emergency parking stickers for IBD sufferers.
attributes.background: I’m trying to be a voice for sufferers of Crohn’s and Colitis which are the two forms of inflammatory bowel disease. One of the main symptoms is an urgent need to use the toilet which, due to general poor accessibility to public toilets can often results in unnecessary incontinence.

attributes.action: The MCA must send launch request to RNLI when fishing boats are reported overdue
attributes.background:
Fishing is the UK's most dangerous peacetime occupation. The Marine & Coastguard Agency must immediately task RNLI lifeboats when 
1) A fishing vessel is reported overdue by a harbour or family member. 2) A distress signal is received.
attributes.additional_details: Any delay in the MCA tasking the RNLI can mean the difference of life and death for a fisherman. There is not an RNLI crew in the country that would mind being called to station to launch, only later to be stood down because all is well with a vessel. A change of protocol to require the MCA to immediately task the local RNLI crews is needed urgently. Worse things happen at sea and even short delays can mean the difference between the rescue of a survivor, or the recovery of a body.

attributes.action: Replace small plastic bags for loose food products with brown paper ones
attributes.background: By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish. We therefore call on the Government to make compulsory changes within all UK supermarkets for the removal of small plastic bags used for loose food products such as fruit, veg, and baked goods and instead, reintroduce brown paper ones.
attributes.additional_details: There are 1 trillion plastic bags made each year with each one taking up to 1000 years to fully decompose, and an even larger figure of 3.95 trillion bags ending up in the world's oceans annually. Brown paper bags, on the other hand, have a degradable period of 1 month and are 100% natural and renewable.  With over 100,000 marine creatures dying a year from plastic pollution and over 1 million seabirds, we are certain that this small change will make a big difference.

attributes.action: Make the teaching of Sexual consent  compulsory In schools
attributes.background:
Rape, Sexual abuse and harassment are prevalent issues effecting our society. 

More needs to be done to tackle these issues. Children need to be taught what constitutes consentual sex and what actions are considered Sexual abuse and harassment as part of the compulsory national curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
The teaching of consent in schools is currently not compulsory. 

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence since. 

Some references:
https://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/09/sexual-consent-lessons-government-criticised-pshea-inadequate

attributes.action: Introduce a national awareness day specifically against plastic in our seas.
attributes.background: People are increasingly aware of how plastic, in all forms, is endangering sea and marine life. It doesn’t decay, possibly for centuries and we’re adding millions of new tons every year. Soon there will be more plastic than life in the sea.
attributes.additional_details: A National Awareness Day is the answer; a day on which all anti-plastic in the sea organisations and individuals could come together to maximise awareness. Britain’s ties to the sea are strong (historical, cultural, economic, geographic) and it would be great if our Government was the first to announce such a national day. Having a National Awareness Day is a win, win, win; for the oceans, people and politicians. There is currently no anti plastic in the sea day, we need one.

attributes.action: Make the maximum wait for CAMHS assesments no more than 6 months.
attributes.background:
Currently the wait to get a child assesed for autism is almost 1.5 years
This is not acceptable and can have serious implications on the child's mental health, as well as causing serious problems within the home. This petition is to try and persuade the government to reduce these waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Waiting times are taken from friends currently on the waiting list in Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Voluntary Right to Buy (VRTB) Scheme for Housing Associations - Update Needed
attributes.background: This petition calls for an update from UK government on the Voluntary Right to Buy Scheme which proposes for the Right to Buy to be extended to Housing Association tenants in England (as pledged in Conservative Manifesto in 2015, piloted with 5 associations and gaining Royal Assent in 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
The government should confirm intentions to deliver the scheme nationally as pledged in 2015. Detail is needed on the timeline for when the scheme will be rolled out nationally, and what the criteria will be for those wishing to apply to purchase their home. 

www.twitter.com/RTBforHA
www.facebook.com/RTBforHA/

attributes.action: Grant the Welsh Assembly the same powers as Scotland currently has.
attributes.background: The Welsh Assembly has been campaigning for greater devolved powers for years, and yet hasn't received any. It's only fair that all the nations should have equal powers devolved to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/magazine/give-the-welsh-more-power

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-politics-38643532

attributes.action: Make Transplant patients Exempt from paying prescription charges
attributes.background: I have recently learnt after going to renew my exemption certificate that Transplant patients are not exempt despite the amount of drugs they have to take for this life threatening illness. I feel this is wrong when other illnesses such as diabetes are exempt.

attributes.action: Cyclists must take a road test, be Licensed and Insured to be on the road.
attributes.background: In light of the recent deaths involving cyclists causing harm or even death to pedestrian or themselves, please sign this petition so that it becomes a legal requirement to undertake a road safety test so to gain license and also have insurance like every other user on the roads.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of White poppies alongside the British Legion red poppy campaign.
attributes.background: Ban the sale of white poppies in November, alongside the RBL Campaign as it is nothing more than a political move that detracts from the good work the legion do and make a mockery of the official remembrance campaign and those that gave their lives for this country.
attributes.additional_details: The white poppy campaign states that it remembers all war dead, which would include civilians and enemy combatants. Not just the enemy of old, but also the despicable fighters from groups like ISIL, who advocate rape and torture. While there is no issue with remembering more than just British Forces personnel who have given their lives, there is a great issue with doing this alongside the official campaign. The white poppy should only be sold at other times of the year.

attributes.action: Raise Statutory Sick Pay for Cancer suffers to minimal wage& extend to 52 weeks.
attributes.background: No person within the UK diagnosed with Cancer should be put into financial difficulties by a large reduction of their income due to Cancer. In some instances, an employer may have a 4 or 8-week full Company sick pay, but after this time, their income drops to the current Statutory Sick Pay.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently employed by a one of the largest UK High street retailers and diagnosed with Cancer on the 15th Sept 2017. On the 2nd Oct (36 hours before I had Cancer surgery), my employer sat me down & informed me that I would NOT be getting paid while I was off recovering from Cancer. I have received my examples through Social Media of similar practices by this employer and by many other UK companies

attributes.action: Introduce interim “pub cap” and a full review of the business rate system
attributes.background: Pubs in St Albans and parts of England have been hit with extortionate business rate increases due to property values increasing over the past decade. We believe there needs to be a fundamental review on the business rate system to stop pubs disappearing from our villages, towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details: We are calling for an immediate interim "Pub Cap" limiting increases in rates bills to 12.5% in England (currently operating in Scotland) and a fundamental review of the whole system to ensure that pubs can survive and this British community asset will not be lost forever.

attributes.action: Allow parents to legally withdraw their child from SATs (NC tests).
attributes.background: Parents should be able to legally withdraw their child from SATs, if they recognise that their child is suffering from the detrimental effects of SATs, or that they simply do not want to subject their child to the unnecessary stress associated with such testing.
attributes.additional_details:
SATs at the end of a child's primary education serve no purpose other than to provide data with which to show a primary school's 'worth', and also perhaps on which secondary schools can base their unrealistic targets for GCSE grades. 
However, subjecting 10 and 11 year olds to such punitive testing is highly stressful and can be hugely demoralising. It has been reported that year 6 pupils have been known to suffer from insomnia and other stress-related conditions. Parents should have the choice.

attributes.action: Repeal the April 2017 changes to Bereavement Support
attributes.background:
Bereavement benefit changed in April from financially supporting the widowed with dependants until the child was 18 years, to now only 18 months after the death of the parent (the 'one off' payment of just over £3000 doesn't even cover the cost of a funeral)
Please read Chloe's story (more details)
attributes.additional_details:
Chloe Leaper is one of the many widows personally harmed by the changes to benefits. 
This awful change to legislation means bereaved families like Chloe’s need to carry an extra financial burden with all the anxiety that brings with it, in addition to the devastation of losing a beloved life partner..... Please read about her situation here, thank you.  
https://www.facebook.com/chloe.leaper.90/posts/10155520963086998

attributes.action: End the Help to Buy scheme and instead direct this funding into social housing
attributes.background: The UK government's funding of the Help to Buy scheme constitutes a fundamental misuse of public funds and fails to deliver the much needed affordable housing for the people of the UK. Property developers are profiteering at the nation's expense whilst failing to provide homes we so desperately need

attributes.action: Stop The Closure Of Darlington A&E
attributes.background: We can’t let Darlington A&E close down. It will cause people to travel excessive distances and if they don't have a car this may not be possible. It will also put strain on the out of town hospitals and will endanger lives that are emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: The Last petition closed early because of a General Election with 7,313 signatures

attributes.action: Pressure Donald Trump to not move the US embassy for Israel to Jerusalem.
attributes.background: The international community doesn't recognise Israel's right over the city. Other religious groups also have legitimate claims to Jerusalem. Trump's intention to move the US embassy should be condemned by the UK government.

attributes.action: Establish an independent body to fact-check the things said during campaigning
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaining world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to the EU; we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new department should consist of teams from Ofcom, Advertising Agency, CPS, ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Insist all supermarkets sell plastic free alternatives for all products sold
attributes.background: Our world is being destroyed by plastic, with up 90% of sea birds alone having been found to have plastic in their guts. We can only begin to imagine the devastation plastic is having on the rest of the marine life, including fish that end up on peoples plates.
attributes.additional_details: We are all responsible, yet I feel our supermarkets have a the biggest responsibility to save our world. I feel it should be a legal obligation that all supermarkets offer plastic free, eco friendly alternatives to ALL their products so shoppers are given choice. At present the only option in most supermarkets is plastic, plastic and more plastic. This HAS to stop. Please sign this petition to ask the government to make it a legal requirement that all supermarkets have plastic free alternatives.

attributes.action: Change the law to get justice for unborn babies killed in the womb during RTA's
attributes.background: When I was 24 weeks pregnant, my son was tragically killed in the womb after I was involved in a major car crash. People who cause road traffic accidents that kill babies in the womb can’t be charged with “death by dangerous driving” as in the eyes of the law a baby in the womb is not a person.
attributes.additional_details: As my son was born after 24 weeks he was classed as stillborn. He has a birth certificate and a death certificate. On his death certificate, his cause of death was written as 'road traffic accident' by medical professionals and signed. It's now also been proven I suffered placenta abruption as a result of the impact of the crash on my bump. If he was 1 day old or 1 week old the driver could be charged! My son had his whole life ahead of him and will never get justice!

attributes.action: I want everybody to have the chance to have one free try of IVF on the NHS
attributes.background: I think its wrong how some people cannot have children through natural reasons but they have to pay for IVF. For example, a couple and say the man has previous children they have to pay then. This is unfair for the woman when people can get nose jobs etc on the NHS its unfair and it needs to change.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attacks
attributes.background: The effects of vitriolage on a victim are lifelong, therefore a life sentence is the only fair way to deal with the perpetrator. Mandatory life sentences would also act as a deterrent, and reduce the number of such heinous attacks in London.

attributes.action: Ban non biodegradable plastic in food/drink packaging. Switch to hemp plastic.
attributes.background: Most drink bottles, tubs and other food packaging are made from petroleum based plastic. This is are toxic to the environment and takes 1000's of years (if ever) to break down. It is polluting the oceans and soil. Eco friendly biodegradable hemp plastic exists but is currently not being used.
attributes.additional_details:
Every week we (in the UK) bury 1000's of tonnes of plastic food and drink packaging. 
More makes its way into the rivers and oceans. It causes massive pollution harming both us and wildlife.
There is an environmentally friendly alternative. Hemp based plastic exists, but at the moment it is not used. 
Mostly because it is not well known about and there is no major manufacturing of it like there is for petroleum based plastics.
For our health and the environment we should make its use mandatory.

attributes.action: Allow carers to study more than 21 hours a week and claim Carers Allowance
attributes.background:
Carers cannot be in full time education and claim Carers Allowance even if they are caring for the 35-hours a week to make them eligible for this benefit. 
This particularly discriminates against young adult carers reaching their full potential in life. 
See www.fixers.org.uk (Lucy Prentice)
attributes.additional_details:
There are 168 hours in each week, so even after deducting 35 hours of caring this still leaves 133 hours which the carer should be able to spend as they wish without restriction in the same way that anyone in paid employment can. It is completely feasible that a carer can provide the number of caring hours required to meet the eligibility for Carers Allowance and still study full time around their caring role.
Please see the film by Lucy Prentice and other young adult carers at www.fixers.org.uk

attributes.action: End the United Kingdom's trading of weapons to Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: Thousands of innocent Yemenese women and children are being slaughtered by our weapons in which we sell to Saudi Arabia; this selfish means of trading needs to be abruptly halted before thousands more innocent civilians die as a consequence.

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary for children
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to host a second referendum for Scottish Independence.
attributes.background: During the first referendum the Scottish public were presented with a number of promises from the Westminster government in the case of a No vote. These promises have since either been broken or forgotten. As a direct result we the undersigned demand a second referendum on independence.
attributes.additional_details:
Broken Promises.
.We were told we would remain in the EU - Despite voting to stay we're leaving. 
.Extensive new powers for the Scottish Parliament - Westminster wishes to now strip powers from Scotland.
.Continuation of the Barnett Formula - There are now talks of cutting Scotland's budget further.
.Work was promised for the shipyards - The amount promised has since decreased and possibly relocated also. 
.Public Sector Jobs
.Social Security
.Renewables
All promised. Non delivered.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
With ever more jobs becoming automatable, risking vast unemployment, a regular unconditional dividend should be paid to every citizen to provide a decent standard of living and stimulate the economy from the bottom up.

This will also reduce crime, healthcare costs and improve education outcomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a further list of reasons to pay a basic income: http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

And some preliminary results from a trial in Finland: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/05/finlands-basic-income-experiment-is-already-making-people-feel-better-after-just-4-months

And a study into the likely impact of automation on future employment:
http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/academic/The_Future_of_Employment.pdf

attributes.action: Universal Credit applicants to receive adequate payments throughout assessment.
attributes.background: Currently Universal Credit applicants can have no income for a minimum of 6 weeks after application. This causes hardship and distress and a legacy of debt and arrears. They need an income, not a loan. Citizens Advice report the wait for first Universal Credit payments can be as long as 10 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Housing Associations and private landlords have the right to trigger eviction after 8 weeks of rent arrears. COSLA has found that in areas where full rollout of Universal Credit has taken place, the level of rent arrears is at least 2.5 times that of those areas still in receipt of housing benefit. Last year, foodbanks in areas of full Universal Credit rollout have seen a 16.85% average increase in referrals for emergency food, more than double the national average of 6.64%.

attributes.action: Remove rip-off compound interest from student loans
attributes.background: Student loans charge a huge 6.1% interest, even during study. Worse, the 6.1% is compounded monthly, meaning interest is added to the loans every month, making loans bigger, so the next month the interest costs even more; the loans get bigger and interest costs increase every month. It is a rip-off.
attributes.additional_details: Even though the base rate is only 0.25%, students are exploited by horrendous 6.1% interest, compounded monthly, being charged on their loans – this can double or treble the size of the loans and massively increase interest costs, too. Most ‘normal’ loans do not do this. It is exploitative. No wonder student loans get bigger even while borrowers are paying off their loans. Sign the petition to remove interest from student loans. More info. here: https://www.afairdealforstudents.com/

attributes.action: Amend PIP rules so that mentally disabled adults can get a Blue Parking Badge.
attributes.background: Currently rules on Personal Independence Payments mean that mobility points, which allow people to access a Blue Badge for disability parking, are allocated on physical capacity to walk, only, not a mental impairment. This is demonstrably unrealistic and impacts people with disabilities and carers
attributes.additional_details: My learning disabled daughter Emily can physically walk but this doesn't mean she can always do so safely. My mum had dementia, she was able to walk but unable to appreciate the dangers around her. A Blue Badge is a passport to understanding and to life. To refuse to allocate a blue badge, unless a person's ability to walk is affected, is morally and factually wrong.This needs to be addressed and urgently amended, so that all disabled people are treated equally by the authorities and by society.

attributes.action: Reduce the content covered at GCSE History so that only 3 Units are studied.
attributes.background: The new History GCSE only caters for the higher ability students and covers over 1200 years of study. There is far too much to cover to do any of the topics justice, regardless of exam board. A limit of 3 units of study needs to be imposed to ensure these units can be taught effectively.

attributes.action: Having knocked over a cat, the driver must legally stop to help/trace the owner
attributes.background: We have lost two cats to road traffic accidents. On both occasions the drivers did not stop to check if the cat could be saved. It is a criminal offence not to stop and report an accident involving a dog. Whilst cats are more independent they are still a beloved pet and should be respected equally.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Brexit once a final agreement with the EU agreed.
attributes.background: Whether we stay or go, I believe that final decision should only be based on clear and understandable information. It is clear that our and EU politicians are more interested in their own politicking rather than ensuring a stable and highly productive Country/Countries.
attributes.additional_details: Inner city Manchester Born and Bred. Degree in Economics. Lived in Moss Side/Whalley Range, Weybridge, Warsaw, Geneva and now back in Weybridge. Have two exceptional daughters for whom I have the only desire to leave a better world for them and future generations. Incredible friends around the world. Together we are something, alone we are nothing. Let's make sure any decision we reach is based on fact not fiction.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1939 Cancer Act so that doctors can offer alternatives to chemo
attributes.background: Doctors are not legally allowed to offer or advise on alternatives for fear of criminal prosecution and the loss of their license to practice.

attributes.action: The government must ring-fence mental health budgets.
attributes.background:
Mental health staff numbers are not increasing at anything like the rate the government claims. The government announced additional funding for mental health, but not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. The government must agree to ring-fence mental health budgets.

.
attributes.additional_details:
Two years ago, the government announced additional funding for mental health - £1.4 billion over five years to deliver the Five Year Forward View for Mental Health and £1.25 billion for the Future In Mind programme for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services. 
We know however that not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. Too many Clinical Commissioning Groups – the bodies that decide how money is spent locally – are using the money for other services.
#mentalhealthmatters

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hand guns and allow everyone to own any firearm.
attributes.background: It's about time the ban on handguns and civilians owning them was lifted. The only people affected by the ban are law abiding citizens that lost their right to own firearms. The ban hasn't stopped criminals from buying or using firearms at all.

attributes.action: Change CICA policy that states children age 12+ can “consent in fact” to sex
attributes.background:
Children from age 12y could be refused compensation for sexual abuse on grounds they consented under revised rules.
The Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) review of its guidelines revealed that almost 700 child victims were denied payments, even where the attacker was jailed.
attributes.additional_details:
The age of consent is 16 for good reason. It reflects the cognitive, emotional and social development required as an absolute minimum to consent to sex. The current CICA guidelines flies in face of this, notwithstanding ignoring the context in which "consent" occurs. Coercion, fear and manipulation are part of these offences and as such "consent in fact" is null and void. 
Such victim blaming is wrong, unhelpful and psychologically damaging. As such, this should be fully debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: I want our country to increase our defence budget to 5% GDP to protect us better
attributes.background: We need to increase our defence budget. The world today is even more unpredictable and dangerous than it's ever been, from the likes of Russia and China being more assertive. I want the UK to be prepared for any major conflict that may come to light in the future and protect our citizens better.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details: It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped.

attributes.action: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome.
attributes.background: Like many children with Irlens Syndrome, my daughter struggles to read. The words and letters "move around the page". This is not actually an optical problem but a problem with the way the brain processes visual information, and can be stopped by simply putting a coloured filter over the words.
attributes.additional_details:
It's possible to get a tinted sheet to lay over her work but this has to be removed for writing. 

To flourish at school she needs glasses with the correct coloured lenses so that she can see her work. They aren't available on the NHS as the prescription is a colour, not curved glass, leaving the parent to pay for a colourimetry test to find the correct shade and depth of colour, the frame and the lenses, costing about £250+ plus regular assessments.

To read, write and reach their potential these children NEED their glasses but are penalised due to their prescription. Glasses for Irlens Syndrome are vital to their education and should be provided on the NHS just like any other children's glasses.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum
attributes.background: Now that the consequences of leaving the EU  are  more widely appreciated it is essential that a second vote is held so that people can make an informed decision about whether they want to remain part of Europe or not.
attributes.additional_details: It is clear that leaving the European union would be an economic, political and social disaster.
